JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: The applicants , whose names appear in the appendix , are NORP nationals . They are represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
On DATE , at TIME , PERSON was gunned down by CARDINAL persons in front of his house in GPE village at LOC of GPE . His mother and to some extent one of his daughters were witnesses to the killing .
On TIME , at TIME , gendarmes at FAC , including its commander Mr PERSON , arrived at the scene .

On TIME , at TIME , CARDINAL gendarmes working as technical personnel at ORG arrived at the scene with the ORG public prosecutor , gendarmes from LOC gendarmerie and a doctor . The technical personnel made a sketch of the scene of the incident , took photographs and secured forensic evidence around the scene . The technical personnel considered that the empty cartridges found at the scene belonged to a MONEY . The doctor carried out a post - mortem examination on PERSON body and concluded that an autopsy had to be carried out to determine the cause of death .

On TIME , the ORG public prosecutor heard evidence from PERSON parents ( PERSON and PERSON ) , his wife ( PERSON ) and a fellow villager . They submitted , inter alia , that they did not know who had committed the murder , that the deceased had previously been convicted of membership of an illegal organisation , namely ORG and ORG ) and that he had returned to the village only recently .
On DATE an autopsy was carried out on PERSON body . The cause of his death was stated as internal bleeding and cerebral haemorrhage due to gunshot wounds .

On DATE the ORG public prosecutor heard evidence from PERSON parents ( PERSON and PERSON ) and daughters ( PERSON and PERSON ) who all affirmed that the deceased had been threatened by ORG . PERSON and PERSON maintained that the perpetrators were wearing masks and military - type clothes . On DATE PERSON parents made an official complaint to the ORG public prosecutor ’s office .

On DATE the ORG public prosecutor heard evidence from PERSON father ( PERSON ) , brother ( PERSON ) , his wife ( PERSON ) and sister ( PERSON ) . They all repeated that the deceased had been threatened by ORG and had been away from the village for DATE prior to his death .

On DATE of the applicants ( “ the complainants ” ) made an official complaint to the ORG public prosecutor ’s office . In this they repeated that that , DATE prior to his death , PERSON had been threatened by ORG and that , as a result , PERSON had left the village for DATE . In this connection , they claimed that this commander was known by the villagers for illegal and harassing activities . Moreover , they noted that it took the security forces from the Bulgurcular gendarmerie command TIME after the incident to reach the village , which was CARDINAL kilometres away .

On DATE the ORG public prosecutor heard evidence from the head of the village ( muhtar ) . The head of the village submitted that neither the deceased nor his family had , prior to the killing , voiced or submitted any representation regarding the alleged threats received by PERSON . He further submitted that after the shooting CARDINAL of the villagers called the gendarmerie CARDINAL or TIME , and that the gendarmes arrived in the village TIME

On DATE the ORG public prosecutor postponed the on - site inspection requested by the applicants until other evidence had been gathered . He further decided that a copy of the documents contained in the case file should be handed over to the ORG legal representative .

On DATE the ORG public prosecutor heard evidence from a gendarme on duty at ORG at the time of the events . The gendarme confirmed that they had received a telephone call at TIME , that they had left the station at TIME and that , due to incidents of terrorism , they had walked through fields rather than using the main road to reach the village .

On DATE , the ORG public prosecutor heard evidence from PERSON PERSON , the Bulgurcular Gendarmerie Commander , who denied the allegations against him . In particular , he submitted that the gendarmes had not been to the village since DATE , that they did not have any vehicles and that they used GCARDINAL and ORG guns . The accused maintained that the deceased had come to the gendarmerie around DATE to ask for their help in obtaining a green card . He further maintained that the deceased might have been killed by the sons of a person killed in DATE and for which killing certain people held the deceased responsible .
On DATE the Van provincial criminal police laboratory carried out a ballistic examination of the cartridges found at the incident scene .

According to an examination of the deceased ’s clothes conducted by CARDINAL experts at FAC on DATE the deceased had received CARDINAL shots at close range and the bullets had entered from the front and exited from his back .
On DATE ORG wrote a report regarding the killing of PERSON . In this report , they pointed to a number of issues which they considered needed to be elucidated in the present case .

On DATE the NORP public prosecutor , relying on the forensic and other evidence in the case file including numerous witness statements , decided not to prosecute PERSON PERSON , the Bulgurcular Gendarmerie Commander , on the ground that there was no cogent evidence to support the allegation that he had abused his office , threatened or killed the deceased . In his elaborated decision the prosecutor examined in particular the issues raised by the applicants and referred to in ORG report . The prosecutor noted , inter alia , that there were certain inconsistencies in the eyewitness accounts of PERSON and PERSON as regards the number of assassins and the type of clothes they were wearing , so that even assuming that the alleged perpetrators were dressed in military clothing , this did not in itself prove that the assailants were soldiers , since such clothing was freely available in the shops and , citing some previous incidents , members of terrorist organisations also wore such garments .

The prosecutor examined the ORG allegations of negligence on account of the belated arrival of the gendarmes from ORG . In this connection , referring to witness statements and information received from ORG , the prosecutor noted , inter alia , that the gendarmes were informed TIME after the incident , that it took them TIME to cross - check the information and to prepare to leave the gendarmerie and that they TIME after walking QUANTITY on foot through fields , for security reasons , under adverse weather conditions . He therefore concluded that there was no intentional belated arrival at the scene of the incident .

As regards the allegations that the deceased had been threatened by ORG and that , as a result , the deceased had left the village for DATE , the prosecutor , after noting serious inconsistencies and contradictions in the various witness statements and the absence of an official complaint to this effect , held that there was no cogent evidence to demonstrate that the deceased had been threatened by the commander . In this connection , the prosecutor also examined the allegations that the commander was threatening others and found them to be unsubstantiated on the same grounds .

Finally , the prosecutor noted , inter alia , that there was strong evidence that PERSON had been killed by a branch of ORG , namely the ORG , on account of a document found on CARDINAL members of the ORG ( ORG ) , who were killed by security forces during a clash on DATE and which implicated the ORG in the killing of the deceased .
On DATE ORG dismissed the ORG objections .
